content.text: A Plea Ignored is a treasure hunt quest in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt.

Far south of Condyle, on the small peninsula, you'll find a grave hag standing over a corpse near a ruined building. Kill her off, then loot the body for a key and a crumpled letter.  sometimes the grave hag doesn't appear until after you opened the chest.

After reading the letter, head to the western side of the burned down building to find the chest and unlock it to complete the quest. It'll have random loot but always has Harvall and Diagram: Impera Brigade armor.

elements.text: Read the letter you found.
Find the valuables in the burned-down home using your Witcher Senses.
Despite being in Velen, in the quest log this quest is labeled as being in Novigrad.

content.text: An Unfortunate Turn of Events is a treasure hunt quest in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt.

To find it, go to the abandoned site north of Lurtch/south of the Devil's Pit (known as Lovers' Landing), and look along the shoreline on the east side of the site (you may need to free the area first to get it). There should be a man's body between one of the destroyed boats and some of the rocks. Loot his corpse for the unsent letter and read it, which will then indicate an area to search further out in the river. There are a couple drowners here, so take them out, then you're free to loot the chest for its contents.

elements.text: Read the letter you found.
Find the cargo that fell off the ferryman's boat by using your Witcher Senses.
Despite being in Velen, in the quest log this quest is labeled as being in Novigrad.

content.text: Battlefield Loot is a treasure hunt quest in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt.

Head to the hidden treasure marker south of the Eternal Fire Chapel (across the river) to find a bilge hag guarding over a dead dog and body. Once she's dead, loot the body for a key and notes, then after reading the notes, follow the blood splatters to the nearby tower structure to find the hidden chest (you may need to destroy the barrels in front of it to get to it). Unlock it to get Bloodsword and some random loot, completing the quest.

elements.text: Read the notes you found.
Follow the blood trail from the battlefield to the loot using your Witcher Senses.
Despite being in Velen, in the quest log this quest is labeled as being in Novigrad.

content.text: Blood Gold is a treasure hunt quest in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt.

Head to the hidden treasure marker northwest of White Eagle Fort, halfway between the other hidden treasure marker for Battlefield Loot. Here you'll find about 6 drowners guarding over a few dead bodies. Once they're dead, loot the body leaning against one of the tables for a key and bloodstained document, then read the letter.
With that, follow the nearby blood trail a short distance to the structure slightly further north, then loot the half-hidden chest here for Headhunter and to complete the quest.

elements.text: Read the letter you found.
Follow the blood trail using your Witcher Senses to find the hidden treasure.
Despite being in Velen, in the quest log this quest is labeled as being in Novigrad.

content.text: Coast of Wrecks is a treasure hunt quest in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt.

Head to the hidden treasure marker on one of the islands just south-southeast of Widows' Grotto to find part of a wrecked ship with a chest with a letter inside. You may have to deal with the nearby drowners and mucknixers before you can loot it for the letter.

After reading the letter, the first chest is just below the one with the letter, in the water. The second one is almost straight down from here, in the deepest part of the ravine, in a small alcove. The third one is straight up from here, on the small island with the explosive barrel, and the final one is on the same island, just to the east, near another ship wreck. All the chests contain random loot and may have diagrams, so you can get as many as 8 here.

elements.text: Read the letter you found.
Find the cargo using your Witcher Senses. 4/4

content.text: Deserter Gold is a treasure hunt quest in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt.

To start the quest, loot the spy's notes from a crate at the hidden treasure marker northeast of the White Orchard mill and northwest of Cackler Bridge. Read the spy's notes to complete the first objective. The quest will complete at this point if you have already looted the pertinent container in the abandoned hut prior to reading the notes.

For the next objective, head to White Orchard's mill. Go to the shack slightly northeast of the windmill, and climb down to the stairs leading down which are obscured by some loose floorboards. Descend into the underground chamber, knocking down the door with the Aard sign. Loot the second chest on the left to complete the quest.

elements.text: Read the letter you found.
Find the deserters' cache using your Witcher Senses.

As the location is out of the way, by the time the player reaches it they most likely already did the related quest, Temerian Valuables, in which case this one will automatically complete after reading the Spy's notes.
If Temerian Valuables has not been triggered, one of the chests in the chamber will be locked.

content.text: Dirty Funds is a treasure hunt quest in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt.

To start the quest you have to loot the hidden treasure located east-northeast of the mill in White Orchard, which is guarded by wolves. Inside you will find some notes, read them and they will lead you to a bandit camp to the east. Kill the bandits then loot the chests inside the tent and the quest ends.
If, however, the bandit camp was looted first the quest will end immediately after looting the hidden treasure, which bares no real consequences except not getting all journal entries.

elements.text: Read the letter you found
Find the bandits' treasure using your Witcher Senses
It's unclear what causes the journal note to change in the quest log or if it's a bug.

content.text: Don't Play with the Gods is a treasure hunt quest in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt.

Head to the elven ruins southeast of Duén Hen (north of Byways) to find numerous wraiths around it. You can either dispatch of them or run through the archway onto the platform which will cause them to disappear but, depending on the time of the day, a noonwraith or a nightwraith will spawn here instead. Whatever you choose, once the threats are dead, loot the body near the start of the stairs for an unsent letter and a key.

You'll find the chest in question on the platform, underneath the toppled statue here. Note that if you didn't deal with her beforehand, the noonwraith (or nightwraith) will spawn shortly after you step on the platform. Once the chest is unlocked the quest completes.

elements.text: Read the notes you found.
Search for treasure in the elven ruins using your Witcher Senses.
Despite being in Velen, in the quest log this quest is labeled as being in Novigrad.

content.text: Dowry is a treasure hunt quest in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt.

At the hidden treasure marker west of Gustfields Farm and north-northeast of White Eagle Fort, you'll find a basilisk guarding over a chest and body. Once the basilisk is dead, loot the woman's body for a key and letter. After reading it, unlock the nearby chest for random loot, completing the quest.

elements.text: Read the letter you found.
Find the treasure chest using your Witcher Senses.
Despite being in Velen, in the quest log this quest is labeled as being in Novigrad.

content.text: Family Fortune is a treasure hunt quest in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt.
Head to the Ruined Inn where, depending if you cleared the area or not, you may have to kill off some sirens before exploring the area.

Enter the house near the monster nest and sea to find a chest with a letter in it, which will point to a location out in the waters roughly in the middle of the small channel to the southwest. Swim or take a boat out there, just be careful of the few sirens here. Once the threats are taken care of, look for the submerged chest that's along the side of the boat to complete the quest.

elements.text: Read the well-worn letter.
Find the treasure in the shipwreck using your Witcher Senses.

content.text: Freya Be Praised! is a treasure hunt quest in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt.

At the hidden treasure marker just southeast of Blandare you'll find a wagon with a dead horse and merchant. Loot the body for a key and letter, and read the letter to learn the location of the hidden chest.

You can likely hear the nearby drowners, however you don't have to fight them if you wish. Instead, you can skirt around to the west, then head out into the waters to find the chest, which contains the D'yaebl sword and miscellaneous loot.

elements.text: Read the crumpled note.
Find the treasure chest using your Witcher Senses.

content.text: Hidden from the World is a treasure hunt quest in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt.
To start this quest, find the hidden treasure marker southeast of Marauders' Bridge, where several bandits are camped out. Kill them off and loot their bodies to find a letter and read it to start.
Now, head south to the marker where you'll see a small hill with rocks and foliage on it. Use your Witcher Senses to spot the container here and loot it to complete the quest.

elements.text: Read the letter you found.
Find the hidden goods mentioned in the letter by using your Witcher Senses.
Despite being in Velen, in the quest log this quest is labeled as being in Novigrad.

content.text: Hidden in the Depths is a treasure hunt quest in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt.

Head to the southwest pat of Faroe Isle to find a cave entrance where, just outside it is an endrega worker guarding a body. Kill it then loot the body for the message and a key. After reading the letter, it'll point you to a location inside the flooded cave.

Head in where you'll have to dive down at one point and swim through the tunnels to reach the other side, where several endrega drones and a venomous arachas await. Once they're all dead, look down one of the dead end tunnels to find the loot to complete the quest.

elements.text: Read the letter you found.
Find the treasure hidden in the underwater cave using your Witcher Senses.
The quest may complete immediately after reading the letter, without directing you to loot the chest in the cavern. Nevertheless, the journal entry updates to say that the chest has been looted.

content.text: Inheritance is a treasure hunt quest in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt.
To start, head to Boxholm and just north of the signpost you'll find a body near a dead bear. Loot the body for a key and letter, then read the letter to start the quest.
Head into the ruined house just northwest of the body (the one with a barrel) to find the chest and loot it for Bloodsword, completing the quest.

elements.text: Read the letter you found.
Find the treasure chest using your Witcher Senses.

content.text: Ironsides' Treasure is a treasure hunt quest in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt.

Head to the hidden treasure marker southeast of Grotto (and far north of Faroe) to find a skeleton and a ruined boat. Loot the skeleton for the notes about treasure and read it to find the next location just east of where you are.
The area is guarded by a couple sirens, so deal with them if necessary then, roughly in the middle of the search area, you'll find the sunken longboat and it's one chest, which contains Gynvael Aedd.

elements.text: Read the notes you found.
Find the sunken treasure using your Witcher Senses.

content.text: Lost Goods is a treasure hunt quest in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt.

To the north of Ferry Station is a hidden treasure marker where you'll find a dead body. Loot it for a note and read to learn of a nearby treasure. Now head towards the water where several drowners are and kill them to loot the chest here and complete the quest.

elements.text: Read the letter you found.
Find the lost chest using your Witcher Senses.
Despite being in Velen, in the quest log this quest is labeled as being in Novigrad.

content.text: Nilfgaardian Treasure is a treasure hunt quest in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt.

To start, go to the far southeast corner of An Skellig to find the hidden treasure marker, a body on a wrecked longboat. Note that there are a couple sirens in the vicinity so you might have to deal with them first. Loot the corpse for the cargo list and read it to learn the location of the treasure is just southeast, out in the ocean.
Swim out to the area and you'll find the chest on the sunken boat here, near the other end of the boat.

elements.text: Read the notes you found.
Find the sunken treasure using your Witcher Senses.

content.text: Not Only Eagles Dare is a treasure hunt quest in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt.

Head to Ulula's Needle on Spikeroog to find a hidden treasure marker and several mucknixers. Once they're killed off, loot the body here for a note and key and read the note to update the search area. Note that in some cases, a drowned dead will spawn nearby once you killed off the mucknixers but if you're far enough away, it won't automatically target you so sometimes you can avoid it here.
Thankfully the chest is nearby on the outer edge of the search area, but depending, you may run into a siren or two here. Once you loot the chest the quest will complete.

elements.text: Read the note you found.
Find the underwater treasure using your Witcher Senses.

45836.title: Out of the Frying Pan, into the Fire

content.text: Out of the Frying Pan, into the Fire is a treasure hunt quest in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt.

To start, head to the abandoned village of Mowshurst and look for a cellar door, making sure to kill off any ghouls along the way. Use Aard, then head down to find a dead body on a bed. Loot the corpse for a key and note, making sure to read the note to start the quest. Now head out to the other side of the village where some haystacks are and look behind the one slightly higher up to find a half hidden chest in it. Loot it to complete the quest.

elements.text: Read the notes you found.
Search the dead man's hiding place using your Witcher Senses.
Despite being in Velen, in the quest log this quest is labeled as being in Novigrad.
The title is in reference to an English idiom "out of the frying pan and into the fire" meaning to go from a bad situation to a worse one.

content.text: Pearls of the Coast is a treasure hunt quest in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt.
Head to the hidden treasure marker located south of Eldberg Lighthouse, on the middle island in the small three island chain here.

The camp itself has a high number of pirates both at the camp and walking around on the roads, so be prepared to deal with a large number of them. After they're all dead, loot the pouch near the campfire for the unsent letter and read it to show the final destination: a location just east of the campsite.
Jump into the water here and dive down to loot the crate, which contains Inis, to complete the quest.

elements.text: Read the unsent letter.
Search for treasure on the sea floor using your Witcher Senses.

content.text: Precious Haul is a treasure hunt quest in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt.

Head to the hidden treasure marker southeast of Tor Gvalch'ca where, along the coast, you'll find a wrecked ship with a body. Loot it for the traveler's notes and read it to reveal the next location is almost exactly north, on the southern tip of the Tor Gvalch'ca island.
Swim out here but be prepared for a couple sirens near the treasure chest. Once they're killed, dive down in the search area to find the chest and complete the quest.
Note that if you find and loot the chest before looting the letter, the quest won't show up in your journal at all.

elements.text: Read the document you found.
Find the sunken cargo using your Witcher Senses.

content.text: Queen Zuleyka's Treasure is a treasure hunt quest in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt.

At the Coast of Wrecks, a large group of pirates have made camp here. You'll have to take out about 10+ pirates before it's safe to access the letter, Pirate's notes, lying on the mattress. Read it to start this quest.

The marker will point you to a location out in the water, northwest of where you got the letter. You can choose to go the long way, which will also take you by guarded treasure out in the waters, or ride along the coast north until you're almost level with the location.

However you reach it, know there's a few drowners in the area. Deal with them, then look to see a sunken ship. You want to be on the eastern side, as that'll have the way in to the treasure. Look for the stairs and swim through the hole to see the treasure chest to the right.

elements.text: Read the letter you found.
Find the sunken treasure using your Witcher Senses.
Despite being in Velen, in the quest log this quest is labeled as being in Novigrad.

content.text: Ruins, Hidden Treasure, You Know... is a treasure hunt quest in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt.

To start this quest, go to Dorve Ruins and, just as you enter the village from the signpost, look to the left to see a skeleton. Loot it for an old key and a mysterious map, with the document pointing you to the tower at the other end of the village. While a wraith will spawn after you loot the skeleton, if you move away quickly enough it won't notice you by the time it spawns.

Head to the tower, which is guarded by several sirens, and kill them off. Once dead, enter and climb up the ladder here to reach the chest. You'll need to click twice on it: once to unlock and a second time to loot it.

elements.text: Unfold the treasure map.
Use the map to find the treasure.

content.text: Scavenger Hunt: Bear School Gear is a treasure hunt in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt and pertains to finding diagrams for Bear School Gear.
This section is for finding the base (standard) gear, while the rest are divided into upgrade quests.

While not needed, the easiest way to get one of the markers is buy one of Ibrahim Savi's maps from Kaer Trolde's armorer. If you don't do the map though, you can start the quest instead by finding one of the diagrams instead.

Probably the easiest to get to when you first arrive in Skellige is to head to Fort Etnir, an unmarked location north of Rogne, however this area has a couple gargoyles and an ice elemental guarding it. Once they're out of the way, head into the eastern room to fin a skeleton and a letter nearby. Loot the letter, then loot the skeleton for another letter and the silver sword diagram. After reading this letter, it'll point you to the other Ard Skellig location on the southern end, Ruined Inn.

Head to the Ruined Inn where, if you haven't already cleared out the site, you may have to deal with some sirens to get to the inn. Just down the stairs though you'll find a couple wraiths to contend with, so make quick work of them to explore the area. You'll find yet another arrest warrant nailed to the walls here but the chest itself is in one of the rooms and contains the steel sword diagram as well as some notes. Reading these will point you to a cave on Spikeroog.

This cave, located south-southwest of the Old Watchtower, is the same one during Contract: Here Comes the Groom. Head into the cave where a drowner will soon try to attack you right near a small fork in the path. Once it's dead, head to the right and up the ledge, carefully jumping and climbing until you see the glowing lights around a skeleton across a gap. Jump over to it then loot the skeleton for the crossbow diagram and a letter.

This letter (if you haven't gotten one of the maps) will point you to Clan Tuirseach's former castle on An Skellig and the location of the last 4 diagrams. The location is near Yngvar's Fang, though you can also get to it from the Trail to Yngvar's Fang instead. Make your way to the bottom floor of the ruins to find a door that leads into the interior but the archway is blocked by an iron gate. With that, head down the stairs to enter a large dungeon area and a lone wraith will spawn as you near the first cell doors. There'a a ballad you can also loot off a skeleton halfway down the hall here that'll tell you Gerd's fate.

Make your way to the end and turn right to see a lever on the wall. When ready, interact with it and while it'll open all the cell doors, it'll also cause a couple more wraiths to spawn. If you want to find the loot in the other cells, ignore the first one to the left from where you pulled the lever (the one with a hole in the ground). Once the rest are looted, head down this hole and make your way through the tunnel where yet another wraith will spawn as you reach the intersection. Head up the stairs and ledges and then use Aard on the rocks to blast your way into the room behind the iron gate. The chest is right across from you in the other corner and contains the armor, boots, gauntlets, and trousers diagrams, as well as another ballad and another document.

elements.text: Find all the diagrams to Bear School witcher gear. 7/7
Search the ruins of Clan Tuirseach's castle.
Read the court chronicler's tome.
Search the ruins of Fort Etnir.
Read Sir Chilton's letter.
Search the ruins of the inn.
Read the innkeeper's notes.
Search the sirens' cave.
Read the letter to Ingeborga.

content.text: Scavenger Hunt: Bear School Gear Upgrade Diagrams - Part 1 is a treasure hunt in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt.
This section covers finding the enhanced diagrams for the boots, armor, and silver sword.
The easiest way to get all the markings on the map is to buy Ibrahim Savi's first map, which will add all the areas to look for these diagrams.

All locations are on Ard Skellig this time though spaced out. The boots diagram is found in an unmarked cave southeast of Wild Shore (the same cave Farting Trolls is found in). Unfortunately these trolls aren't civil and will try to attack you so kill them off then look around the rubble where you'll find the chest with the diagram near a broken boat.

The armor diagram is found in the Grotto (the same cave that's part of The Sad Tale of the Grossbart Brothers). Make your way all the way around to the last chamber and where the three brothers are, then kill them off. The chest in question is in the southern part of the chamber, near one of the bed mats.

The silver sword diagram is found at an unmarked ruin northeast of Kaer Gelen. You'll likely be attacked by a group of harpies as you enter this fortress, so take care of them before proceeding further, as just as you head into the interior, alghouls appear. Make your way through the ruins and the tunnel before you find the last room with yet more alghouls. After they're defeated, you can find the chest opposite of where you entered.

elements.text: Find the silver sword upgrade diagram using your Witcher Senses.
Find the silver sword upgrade diagram.
Find the boots upgrade diagram using your Witcher Senses.
Find the boots upgrade diagram.
Find the armor upgrade diagram using your Witcher Senses.
Find the armor upgrade diagram.

content.text: Scavenger Hunt: Bear School Gear Upgrade Diagrams - Part 2 is a treasure hunt in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt.
This section covers finding the enhanced diagrams for the gauntlets, trousers, and steel sword.
The easiest way to get all the markings on the map is to buy Ibrahim Savi's second map, which will add all the areas to look for these diagrams.

The gauntlets are found on Ard Skellig, at an unmarked ruin northeast of Rogne and southeast of Fort Etnir. Head up the stairs on the north side to the tower here to find the chest with the gauntlets diagram.

The steel sword is located at Kaer Almhult, on a small island to the west of Eldberg Lighthouse. The former prison is crawling with pirates and guard dogs so be prepared for a tedious fight here. From the main entrance into the courtyard area, head behind the overturned wagon to the right and go up the stairs. The chest is at the end of the small hallway here, containing the steel sword diagram.

The trousers location requires some sailing to get to, as it's on an island northeast of Marlin Coast. On the southern side, near the middle, you'll find a small cave that you'll need to swim into to find the chest, which contains the trousers diagram.

elements.text: Find the gauntlets upgrade diagram using your Witcher Senses.
Find the gauntlets upgrade diagram.
Find the steel sword upgrade diagram using your Witcher Senses.
Find the steel sword upgrade diagram.
Find the trousers upgrade diagram using your Witcher Senses.
Find the trousers upgrade diagram.

content.text: Scavenger Hunt: Bear School Gear Upgrade Diagrams - Part 3 is a treasure hunt in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt.
This section covers finding the superior diagrams.
The easiest way to get all the markings on the map is to buy Ibrahim Savi's third map from the armorer at Kaer Trolde, which will add all the areas to look for these diagrams.
All the diagrams for this quest are located in Velen and some can be found early on enough you might have found them before getting the map.

All the armor diagrams are found in a cave northwest of the Hanged Man's Tree (the same cave you can visit during A Deadly Plot). If you don't have that quest active, you'll find several nekkers and a nekker warrior just outside the entrance. Head inside and as the path curves, you'll find a small alcove to the left, with one of the chests here containing the armor, boots, gauntlets, and trousers diagrams.

The steel sword diagram is found at the Ruined Tower, though guarded by an Earth Elemental. Once it's dead, look on one of the broken floor pieces on the eastern side to find the chest (it's half hidden behind a large tree and a nearby bush).

The silver sword diagram is found in a cave on the edges of the bog, southwest of The Orphans of Crookback Bog (the same cave during Contract: Swamp Thing). Note that there's actually 3 entrances into this cave so even if you haven't progressed far enough in the main questline to get The Eye of Nehaleni, you can still get inside. If you don't have the eye, keep heading west until you find a cave marker noting the one open entrance. If you have the eye though, simply use it on the area the quest marker indicated on the map. If you haven't already killed Ignis Fatuus and you took the one open entrance in, you'll have to fight some foglets and Ignis Fatuus himself before you can find the diagram. If you used the hidden entrance the map led you to though, head in to fight a foglet, then stick to the wall on the left to find a body with the chest behind him containing the diagram.

elements.text: Find the silver sword upgrade diagram using your Witcher Senses.
Find the silver sword upgrade diagram.
Find the steel sword upgrade diagram using your Witcher Senses.
Find the steel sword upgrade diagram.
Find the armor upgrade diagram using your Witcher Senses.
Find the armor upgrade diagram.

content.text: Scavenger Hunt: Bear School Gear Upgrade Diagrams - Part 4 is a treasure hunt in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt.
This section covers finding the mastercrafted diagrams.
The easiest way to get all the markings on the map is to buy Ibrahim Savi's fourth map, which will add all the areas to look for these diagrams.

The steel sword diagram is found northwest of Blackbough, in a cave behind The Pellar's hut (the same cave area the bear is just outside of during A Princess in Distress). If that quest isn't active, you'll find several nekkers here instead. Once they're dead, head inside and, minding the 2 drops, in the large chamber follow the wall on the right past a deer corpse to find the chest behind the column here.

The silver sword diagram is found northeast of Olena's Grove, on the small island with a monster nest. Drowners will continuously spawn here until you take out the nest, so either quickly grab the diagram from the chest in the hole next to the rock or take out the nest first.

The armor diagrams are found at the Destroyed Bastion and guarded by a cyclops. The chest itself can be found near the grindstone, in a small area between several walls, and contains the armor, boots, gauntlets, and trousers diagrams.

elements.text: Find the steel sword upgrade diagram using your Witcher Senses.
Find the steel sword upgrade diagram.
Find the silver sword upgrade diagram using your Witcher Senses.
Find the silver sword upgrade diagram.
Find the armor upgrade diagram using your Witcher Senses.
Find the armor upgrade diagram.

content.text: Scavenger Hunt: Cat School Gear is a treasure hunt in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt and pertains to finding diagrams for Cat School Gear.
This section is for finding the base (standard) gear, while the rest are divided into upgrade quests.

You can start this quest either by finding one of the diagrams, finding Julia Keynon's diary, or buying one of the associated maps, with the first or second in Blackbough, the third in Crow's Perch, and the fourth in Lindenvale.

All the armor diagrams are found below Temple Isle, though the way to find it is a bit tricky. On your map note the furthest western house on the island (2 buildings over from the marker if you have it on). You want to head to that house and, on the western side of it, you'll find a rock ledge that drops down to a grassy path, this is the path you want to use.

Follow the path all way to the end, where you'll need to use The Eye of Nehaleni to reveal the cave entrance, and head in. The main chamber inside has a golem guarding the area, so kill it off to continue exploring. You don't need to explore the path to the right when you first entered the area (the one with a blocked archway) but if you want you can head in to find Invoice for a golem on a skeleton here, just be prepared to face a wraith after you get it.

The main door in the chamber is locked, so instead make your way down the tunnel opposite of where you entered to find several statues around an open floor area. While not needed, you can pick up the research notes near one of the statues, and mysterious recipe in the corner. Note also a wraith may spawn here and attack. The puzzle itself is simple: you just need to make all the statues face the center of the room by pulling on the levers (thankfully each statue is only controlled by a lever next to it, so you just need to focus on making them face the right direction). Once done, the floor will open up in the center revealing a deep pool with 3 drowners. You'll need to kill them off and then dive down to grab a key at the bottom.

With that, head back to the main chamber to open the door here to find on the far end Mad Kiyan. As he was a witcher, he will use some signs, like Quen, so be prepared for that as he'll attack you on sight. You can then loot him for the armor, boots, gauntlets, and trousers diagrams as well as moonblade and laboratory notebook. Reading this notebook will add the location west of Grassy Knoll if it hasn't already been found.

Prepare to swim or sail a fair distance here, as the location is on a small island southwest of the Lighthouse and northwest of Widows' Grotto. Here you'll find the Flying Stag. Climb onto it then head down the stairs to find the chest nearby with the crossbow diagram and mage's notes. Reading this will add Est Tayiar as another location to check out as well as Temple Isle. The captain's log can be looted from a skeleton on the island's shore for further story information.

Head to Est Tayiar and carefully drop down through the hole here to the bottom to find on one side a weakened wall. Use Aard on it to reveal a small area with a skeleton containing the silver sword diagram and Professor Sigismund Gloger's notes. Reading this will point to Drahim Castle.

Head to Drahim Castle and blast away the wooden door, then climb down the ladders until you reach the lowest floor. The steel sword diagram is here along with Prince Adrien's journal. Reading this will add the Est Tayiar and the shipwreck off Grassy Knoll locations.

elements.text: Find the diagrams to all the elements of Cat School witcher gear. 7/7
If diary is found before the quest concludes:
Read Julia Kenyon's diary.
Explore the passages under Temple Isle.
Read the laboratory log.
Search the wreck of the "Flying Stag."
Read the mage's notes.
Explore the ruins of Est Tayiar.
Read Professor Gloger's note.
Explore the ruins of Drahim Castle.
Read Prince Adrien's journal.

content.text: Scavenger Hunt: Cat School Gear Upgrade Diagrams - Part 1 is a treasure hunt in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt.
This section covers finding the enhanced diagrams for the boots, armor, and silver sword.
The easiest way to get all the markers on the map is to buy Adalbert Kermith's first map from Blackbough's gwent merchant.

The silver sword diagram is found just inside Oxenfurt Gate. The marker here can be a little confusing as it's up on the grassy ledge area just inside Novigrad. Climb up here then, behind the trees, you should find a ladder to climb up to enter someone's home. Make your way up to the next floor and you should find the diagram in the chest here.
The armor diagram is found at Aeramas' Abandoned Manor. Head up to the top floor here and you'll find a chest with the diagram in it.

The boots diagram is found in a large cave to the east of Toderas (the same cave where Contract: Phantom of the Trade Route takes place). Head into the cave and as you near the end of the tunnel and start to reach the main chamber, you'll see the chest to the right, slightly hidden if you're coming from the northern cave entrance (if you reach the area where the survivors are you've gone too far, unless you entered through the southern entrance, in which case it's further past them).

The easiest way to get all the markers on the map is to buy Adalbert Kermith's second map from Blackbough's blacksmith.

The gauntlets diagram is found at Codgers' Quarry, near one of the Looters group. If you approach with weapon drawn they'll be immediately hostile, but if sheathed, they'll talk but essentially want you to leave, however alghouls suddenly attack ending that conversation. If saved, the men will thank you and you can then head into the cave here to find the chest with the diagram.

The trousers diagram is found in Oxenfurt, in the house just to the east of the blacksmith. Enter the main floor and, near where the cat marker is, climb down the ladder and follow the tunnel into a room with 2 gates on either side. Use your Witcher Senses on the area between the brick wall and the gate on the right to find a brick you can interact with, opening a hidden room on the brick wall. Inside is the chest containing the diagram.

The steel sword diagram is found in a cave just northeast of Reardon Manor (the same cave during Fools' Gold). If the quest is active, bandits will be just outside the cave and inside as well. If you don't have the DLC though, a bear will be here instead. Regardless, the chest you want is near the end, on the left (opposite corner from the elven ruins).

All the armor diagrams are located at an unmarked ruin southwest of Dragonslayer's Grotto and guarded over by an Earth Elemental. Once it's dead, you can find the chest in the largest part of the remains, situated between 3 walls, and contains the armor, boots, gauntlets, and trousers diagrams.

The silver sword diagram is found east of Ursten, at a monster den. Here you'll find a large number of nekkers. As you head inside and go down a second set of stairs you'll also encounter a rabid rock troll and more nekkers. Kill them off, then look to the right from where you entered (facing into the chamber that the troll was in) and you'll see a small ledge behind the columns here. Climb up and destroy the small stalagmites to find the chest behind them with the diagram.
The steel sword diagram is found at the Cavern. Head in to find a golem guarding the chest so kill it off, then loot the chest off the wooden platform here for the diagram.

This section covers finding all the mastercrafted diagrams.
The easiest way to get all the markers on the map is to buy Adalbert Kermith's fourth map from Lindenvale's blacksmith.

For these you're headed back to Skellige. The steel sword diagram will likely be the easiest one to find early on, as it's at Kaer Gelen on Ard Skellig. From the gated entrance head around to find the other entrance on the eastern side and where several wraiths will spawn as you enter. After they're dead, continue on until you reach the cat symbol and head up the stairs on the right. Just before you reach the next small landing, to your left you should see a small opening: go in here to find the chest with the diagram.

The other two locations are on Faroe Isle. The silver sword diagram is in a cave east of Harviken, just below the area where Jutta an Dimun is fighting. Head inside and use Aard on the farthest wall (the one on the left just has minor loot inside). Follow the short tunnel to the end to find the chest with the diagram inside it.

All the armor diagrams are located south-southwest of Trottheim, in a cave on the southern shore. Depending, you might have to fight some sirens and harpies before you can safely enter the cave itself. Ignore the statues here (they're not needed for this quest) and head left from the statues to find a chest just behind a column with a skeleton next to it and contains the armor, boots, gauntlets, and trousers diagrams.

content.text: Scavenger Hunt: Griffin School Gear is a treasure hunt in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt and pertains to finding diagrams for Griffin School Gear.
This section is for finding the base (standard) gear, while the rest are divided into upgrade quests.

You can start this quest by either finding one of the locations of the diagrams and reading the related documents found with them, or by buying one of the treasure maps available, as all of them will point to starting at Dragonslayer's Grotto. The easiest maps to obtain early on are the first and second from Midcopse's armorer.

This diagram is found at Hindhold and one of the easiest locations to get to early on in the game. Here you'll find the area is guarded by endrega workers and warriors, so kill them off as you make your way up to the top, where a harpy's nest is. Take out the group, then pass through the wooden door up here and loot the crate to find and read Witcher George's confession and then loot the skeleton for Balstick's letter and the first piece, Diagram: Griffin steel sword. This will add 2 further locations to explore if you don't have them already.

The lighthouse is more time consuming to get to, and requires traveling all the way to Lornruk at the top end of Crow's Perch region. Here you'll find a wyvern has made the place its home. As it's not a good idea to fight it in the tower, draw it's attention to your side of the bridge and kill it off first, then jump down into the waters below (make sure to look before you jump, as you can die if you hit the rocks below). You'll find drowners in the water near the place of power here marking the entrance into the tower, so kill them then dive down and enter the cave here (should be marked by the cave entrance icon).

Climb up the ledges then the ladder and make your way up until you exit out on the other side of the bridge. With that, turn around to face the door again that you just went through to see another ladder and climb up here to find a chest with Diagram: Griffin silver sword along with Crafting notes. While not needed, you can head up the lighthouse tower until you find a chest with Dobromir's journal beside it for a bit more insight.

All the armor diagrams are found in Dragonslayer's Grotto, the final resting place for George. Drop down into the area and while you can examine a griffin marker on the archway if you wish, it doesn't do much if you already have the location marked in the quest. Head inside to confront a couple wraiths then make your way down the hall (nothing quest related is off to the area on the right, but you can go in there to face more wraiths to get some loot and possible random diagrams if you want).

Further down the hall you'll soon find a weak wall. Blast it with Aard but don't rush in yet as there's another wraith here as well as toxic gas clouds. Deal with the immediate threat first, then using either Igni or Aard, temporarily dispel the clouds. Halfway through this tunnel you may find more wraiths, so draw them back to a safe area to deal with them, then you should be able to continue all the way to the end unhindered. Before you blast away the rocks here, prepare yourself as an ekimmara is on the other side. Once ready, blast them and face off against the final monster. Once it's dead you'll see there's a number of things you can loot here, but what you want is the chest with the glowing lights, which contains Witcher George's journal and all 4 armor diagrams: armor, boots, trousers, and guantlets. If you found this location first, the journal will mark the other 2 areas. If you've also completed the main questline far enough to have The Eye of Nehaleni, you can head through the opposite tunnel from where you entered and exit out near the place of power further up the hill.
The order in which these objectives appear may differ depending on the order in which the locations are visited.

There's a leshen on the surface that can sometimes home in and teleport to where you are when you reach the final room in the grotto and, depending on your level, it can be difficult if not impossible to kill so you may need to load a previous save if so.
Despite being in Velen, the quest logs puts it as Novigrad region.

content.text: Scavenger Hunt: Griffin School Gear Upgrade Diagrams - Part 1 is a treasure hunt in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt.

While you can find the diagrams by just exploring, an easy way to get all the locations marked is to buy Edwin Greloff's first map from the armorer in Midcopse, which will then reveal them all.

If you bought the map, the closest one is the bandit camp on the peninsula west of the abandoned site nearby. There's a fair number of pirates here, and while you don't need to kill them all off, you likely will need to do so to get to the chest, which is within the ruins and just up a small flight of stairs and contains the enhanced steel sword diagram.

The next closest is likely at the Burned Ruins (the same location near the Shrieker's cave). For this, just head up to the ruins and, half hidden in the large pile of burnt wood, you'll find a chest with the trousers diagram.

The farthest location is not near a signpost. On the northern end of Mudplough are some unmarked ruins with a forktail flying around the general location of the chest. Once the forktail is dead, look for the chest on the western side of the ruins, in a small, cornered off section of 3 walls and contains the boots diagram.

Head to Frischlow where you'll find wraiths have taken up residence and make your way to the southern part of the village to find a guarded treasure in the cemetery where a noonwraith will also make her appearance. You may notice sounds of digging at the entrance to the small cave, if you use the Magic lamp here you will witness a ghost using a pickaxe.

While you can find the diagrams by just exploring, an easy way to get all the locations marked is to buy Edwin Greloff's third map from the armorer in Hierarch Square, which will then reveal them all.

The silver sword diagram is found near Elverum Lighthouse on the southern tip of Ard Skellig, in a large cave. As you head in through the unmarked entrance, go right at the first split and continue to follow it all the way to the final room. The diagram is in one of the chests in the area behind the tomb.

All the armor diagrams are found in the top northeastern part of Ard Skellig, near Giants' Toes. There's a medium sized group of pirates/bandits here though all along the coastline, so kill them off and make your way to the last campfire and you should find the chest among the rocks nearby, containing the armor, gauntlets, trousers, and boots.

The steel sword diagram is found on An Skellig, west of Yngvar's Fang, though it might be easier to fast travel to Urialla Harbor and ride Roach to the spot instead. You'll likely be spotted by some bandits nearby, so kill them off as you approach the stone shrine with the griffin marking carved into it. The chest with the diagram is just behind the stone.

content.text: Scavenger Hunt: Griffin School Gear Upgrade Diagrams - Part 4 is a treasure hunt in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt.

While you can find the diagrams by just exploring, an easy way to get all the locations marked is to buy Edwin Greloff's fourth map from Éibhear Hattori, which will then reveal them all.

All of them can be found on Ard Skellig this time, though spaced out. The silver sword diagram is found at the ruins east of Fornhala, Kaer Dhu. Simply look in the western tower to find the chest with the diagram in the small area to the left of the archway.

The steel sword diagram is located in Boxholm, in the ruins east of the signpost. If you've done Contract: Missing Son already, this is the same area where Morvudd runs off to. In this area, climb up the eastern wall and the chest with the diagram is to the north, in under some rubble.

All the armor diagrams are found together in the ruins northeast of Redgill and southeast of Whale Graveyard. There's a cyclops here who's not thrilled you're invading his space though so kill him off to safely explore the ruins (just mind the open side to the ocean as you could fall to your death there). Once dead, look for the griffin marker on the boulders just outside the ruins on the north side and then climb up these boulders to reach the second floor of the ruins. Carefully head in as there's a hole in the middle of this room to find 2 chests and an aard place of power, with one of the chests containing the diagrams for the armor, boots, trousers, and gauntlets.

content.text: Scavenger Hunt: Viper School Gear is a treasure hunt quest in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt.
In The Witcher 3, the only Viper School Gear available are 2 sword diagrams, both of which can be found in White Orchard:

elements.text: Viper silver sword
Viper steel sword

content.text: For the silver sword, the diagram can be found in White Orchard cemetery, in the chapel's basement. Note that the outside of the chapel is guarded by a wraith, who will retreat if you don't kill it fast enough. However, even if you do manage to kill it, another will appear (or the first if you didn't kill it) in the basement as you approach the diagram's location. Once taken out, retrieve the Serpentine Silver Sword diagram from the skeleton.

The steel sword diagram can be found near the Ransacked Village at the old watchtower (look for the bandit camp marker to the west of the Ransacked Village). You can either try to skillfully jump up the side furthest from the remains or walk around the base until you see a pile of bricks that can be climbed up. However you arrive on top of the plateau, take out the deserters here, being mindful not to fall off. Once they're all dead, look for a chest inside the ruined watchtower to find the Serpentine Steel Sword diagram.

With the Hearts of Stone expansion, new swords and a full set of Viper School Gear armor has been added to the game. However, finding these new items can be easily missed if the player skips over certain optional objectives while completing the main quests.

All the armor diagrams can be bought from Countess Mignole during the main quest, Open Sesame!. As you enter the Borsodi Brothers' Auction House as Vimme Vivaldi's guest, he'll eventually point out a number of people that you can talk to before the auction. To get the diagrams, talk to the Countess and eventually Vivaldi points out perhaps Geralt and Mignole can trade some items and a merchant icon will appear in the next conversation choice. This is your one and only chance to get all the viper armor diagrams (armor, boots, gauntlets, and trousers).

For the Viper venomous steel sword diagram, continue the Open Sesame! quest to the end, where you will eventually end up in a vault. The diagram will be in a chest near Maximilian Borsodi's house. Like the armor diagrams, you can't return after you leave the vault, so make sure to grab it before you go.

The final piece of the set, the Viper venomous silver sword, does not have a diagram available. Instead, the player can retrieve this sword but only if additional steps are taken. When you've progressed to the quest Whatsoever a Man Soweth... do not head out to the temple just yet. Instead, go do the optional objectives with Shani to find and talk to Professor Shakeslock, who will give you very useful information in dealing with Master Mirror. Once that's finished up, head out to the temple and eventually Master Mirror will try to claim his prize and a timed choice will appear. Choose to help Olgierd, which will lead to Geralt challenging Master Mirror. He'll accept and then teleport Geralt to a twisted world. To find the sword, follow the steps below (as long as you don't interact with anything else in the world, you'll have plenty of time to solve the riddle and get the sword):

elements.text: Head down the path away from the temple.
When the path forks, ignore the point of interest on the left-hand side and follow the fork on the right.
Kill the Foglet specters.
When the path splits again, take the left (it'll look like 3 paths, but the far left is not part of the split)

Continue straight along the path and go under the bridge, then take the left path. When the path splits, go right and you'll see a red glowing point of interest. Defeat the Hym specter around here. The sword is in the stone at this point of interest.

content.text: The order in which these objectives appear may differ depending on the order in which the locations are visited. There is also no official quest entry for Hearts of Stone.

elements.text: Find diagrams for all the elements of Viper School gear. 0/2
Read the report.
Search the castle ruins.
Find Kolgrim's remains.
Read Kolgrim's letter.

content.text: Scavenger Hunt: Wolf School Gear is a treasure hunt in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt and pertains to finding the diagrams for Wolf School Gear, which was added on as a DLC.
This section is for finding the base (standard) gear, while the rest are divided into upgrade quests.
The easiest way to get the markers on the map is to buy one of the maps, with the easiest one early on being the slightly torn notes from Lindenvale's blacksmith.

The armor diagrams are in the old signal tower, an unmarked location just south of the Kaer Morhen signpost. However, as it's up a steep cliff, you'll need to ride down the valley some and then back up to get to it. As you make your way up the steps to the tower a couple erynias may attack if they spot you here. Head in and go straight, climbing up over the wall, to find some scaffolding here. Climb up to the first level to find Hieronymus' notes in a chest, which will add the Ruined Watchtower and the Bastion as other areas to check out, as well as noting you need to examine the portal mechanism. While not needed, you can also loot the nearby skeleton for Pang of Conscience and a letter of apology.

You can then examine the portal area on the ground level if you wish, though you need the polished crystal, so head back the way you entered the tower but this time climb through the crack in the wall on the right (if facing the exit). Carefully walk through here and climb up onto the scaffolding on the outside of the tower and near the end, look up to see the crystal on a ledge to grab it. Head back and interact with the mechanism to add it, then hit it with Aard to charge it. Do not try to jump through the portal yet though, as it's not stable enough (indicated by it flickering). You'll need to hit the other mechanism opposite the one you just charged up and that'll stabilize the portal. Once done, jump through it and it'll spit you out in a cave. As you near the cave exit a wraith will spawn here, so kill it off and then loot the skeleton here for the armor, boots, gauntlets, and trousers diagrams as well as some notes.

Head to the Bastion where, if you haven't already visited it, wraiths will come out to greet you so make quick work of them, then head inside. In the burned wooden remains you'll find a skeleton containing the steel sword diagram and Varin's journal.

Head now to the Ruined Watchtower on the northern end of the valley where yet another wraith will spawn. After it's dead, loot the skeleton it'd spawned near for the silver sword diagram and a journal.

Search the ruins of the signal tower near Kaer Morhen.
Read the mage Hieronymus' notes.
Use your Witcher Senses to examine the portal's mechanism.
Find the missing crystal needed to power the generator.
Mount the crystal in the generator and charge it using a Sign.
Charge the crystal using the Aard Sign.
Use your Witcher Senses to examine the portal's mechanism.
Enter Hieronymus' portal and explore the location on the other side.
Read Hieronymus' last words.
Search the ruins of the bastion near Kaer Morhen.
Read Varin's journal.
Search the ruined watchtower near Kaer Morhen.
Read Chird's journal.

content.text: Scavenger Hunt: Wolf School Gear Upgrade Diagrams - Part 1 is a treasure hunt in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt.
This section covers finding the enhanced diagrams for the boots, armor, and silver sword.
The easiest way to get these marked on the map is to buy the well-preserved notes from Éibhear Hattori.

The silver sword diagram is just below Crow's Perch and you may find it during Bloody Baron quest if you took the well to get inside. To get to it, enter the well through Crow's Perch's garden (as the outside cave area may be blocked depending where you're at in the main questline) and head down the ramp until you reach a leveled out area with a pool of water where a water hag may or may not be depending on the quest. Head towards the pool of water but stay on dry land and head right and you'll find the chest at the end of this path.

For the armor, prepare to sail or swim quite a bit. You want to head to the island that's south of Fyke Isle, where a ruin has all but collapsed into the waters below. There are a number of submerged chests in this area, but the easiest way to find the diagram is to stand at the wolf marker and, facing south, use your Witcher Senses and look almost directly down and you'll see a highlighted chest slightly to the left: that's the one you want.

The boots diagram is found at the Grotto in eastern Velen. Head in and take either path (both go to the same chamber, though if you go right, make sure to take the left path at the next split). If you took the left path initially the chest will be just to your right as you enter the chamber, past the stalagmites, while if you took the right path initially it'll be to your left as you enter the large chamber.

content.text: Scavenger Hunt: Wolf School Gear Upgrade Diagrams - Part 2 is a treasure hunt in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt.

The easiest way to get the markers on the map is to buy the slightly torn notes from Lindenvale's blacksmith.

For the gauntlets diagram, head all the way south to a cave in Kaer Morhen valley in the southeastern part of the region. Enter the cave and head right then left and up the ledge here to the main chamber. The chest is just to the left, partially hidden by the plants.

The trousers diagram is to the north-northeast of Lakeside Hut, on the small island at the mouth of the inlet. The chest itself is actually in the water: from the wolf marker, look south and you should see it there in the water (you may need to use your Witcher Senses to help highlight it).

The steel sword diagram is at the Ruined Watchtower where a wraith might spawn if you hadn't already visited the area. The chest is up on one of the scaffolding. From the signpost, head up the slope on the left of the doorway here, then turn and jump over to the platform on the right to loot the chest.

content.text: Scavenger Hunt: Wolf School Gear Upgrade Diagrams - Part 3 is a treasure hunt in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt.
This section covers finding the superior diagrams for the armor, silver sword, and steel sword.
The easiest way to get these marked on the map is to buy the damp, moldy notes from Kaer Trolde's armorer.

The silver sword diagram is found just southeast of Arinbjorn, at some unmarked burial mounds, in the most western mound (in case you're trying to find the wolf marker, it's on the ceiling above the archway). The chest itself is to the left, next to the large, wooden tub.

The armor diagram is found at Fort Grymmdjarr, an unmarked ruin to the southwest of Fyresdal. Here, harpies have made it their home though, so you'll need to kill them off first to search around. The marker here is also on the ceiling, but the chest isn't on the ground level. Instead, from the archway facing into the interior, head right on the outside of the fort until you can jump over the wooden barrier (it'll be right before the first tower) then follow it to the left until you reach the end and where the chest is.

The steel sword diagram is on Hindarsfjall, to the southwest of Lofoten, though you have to find either the ledge to the north of the ruins or southwest to get up to them. You'll likely find a hostile ice troll in the vicinity so deal with the threat, then head down the hole near the marker into the ruin's lower levels. While there's no enemies down here, there's highly toxic gas clouds here that tend to re-appear very quickly. Use Aard or Igni to clear the way or drink the Golden Oriole potion to get to the chest in the far left corner for the diagram.

content.text: Scavenger Hunt: Wolf School Gear Upgrade Diagrams - Part 4 is a treasure hunt in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt.
This section covers finding the superior diagrams for the boots, gauntlets, and trousers.
The easiest way to get these marked on the map is to buy the heavily faded notes from Hierarch Square's armorer.

The trousers diagram is found in a cave northwest of Kaer Morhen and north of the Bastion. Head inside and follow the path, where along the way you'll come across a few nekker warriors and a devourer. From the area where you can come across the first table apparatuses and mutagen bottles, go just past the one on the left and you'll see the chest behind the stalagmites (you've gone too far if you reach the small set of stairs).

The gauntlets diagram is found at Iron Mine. Head in but be careful as an Earth Elemental is in the main room. Once it's killed you'll find the diagram on the small altar like table near the hidden tunnel.

The boots diagram requires a bit of manual traveling/swimming, as it's in a cave to the east of the keep and not near any signposts. Once you enter the cave you can find the wolf marker just behind the small waterfall on the left, then head right the drop down to the lower level and fight any endrega warriors and workers here. Once it's safe, from where you dropped down (facing into the cavern), follow the wall on the right and go around the large stone column here and on the other side, behind more stalagmites, you'll see the chest.

Sometimes the endregas won't spawn correctly and while you'll hear them, there will be nothing to fight there.

content.text: Scavenger Hunt: Wolf School Gear Upgrade Diagrams - Part 5 is a treasure hunt in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt.
This section covers finding the mastercrafted diagrams for the armor, silver sword, and steel sword.
The easiest way to get these marked on the map is to buy the worn-out and faded notes from Éibhear Hattori.

The steel sword diagram you'll need to swim or sail out to, as it's out in the waters far west of Byways and marked by the sunken ship's mast (and also the location of a sunken treasure marker). Drowners tend to spawn around here and while the wolf marker is in the captain's cabin, the chest you need is below deck, so swim down the stairs and the chest will be right behind them.

The armor diagram is just to the southeast of Byways, at some unmarked elven ruins. The chest you're looking for is in one of the fountains on the ground level (the left one if looking towards the stairs with the elven archway decoration). Wraiths may spawn here if you move closer towards the chest up on the stairs (as they're related to the guarded treasure marker).

The silver sword diagram is located at a hidden treasure marker south-southwest of Kimbolt Way, but guarded over by a fiend. You'll need to kill it so you can then loot a corpse near the wooden door for a key and notes. Once you have the key, go unlock the door and you'll find the chest in the far back of the small room here.

content.text: Scavenger Hunt: Wolf School Gear Upgrade Diagrams - Part 6 is a treasure hunt in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt.
This section covers finding the mastercrafted diagrams for the boots, trousers, and gauntlets.
The easiest way to get these marked on the map is to buy the notes on parchment from Kaer Trolde's armorer.

For the gauntlets diagram, head to Kaer Nyssen, the ruined fortress overlooking Boxholm. However, be careful here if you haven't done Contract: Missing Son yet, as a powerful fiend, Morvudd, is here as well. If he is, you'll need to fight him enough to make him run off before you can look around. Facing the wolf marker, go left and all the way to the corner here where some containers are, then climb up the northeastern wall, then head back right and you should see the chest at the other end, against the tower.

The trousers diagram is found at the Old Watchtower on Spikeroog and where a group of bandits have set up camp. Kill them all off then, facing the wolf marker, look up and to the right and you'll see the chest you need to get to. To do so, you can simply position yourself just below it then jump up and Geralt should climb up.

The boots diagram is found on Undvik, in the Dorve Ruins. At the ruins, head to the outside southwestern corner and you should find the chest here, in a corner between 2 walls and a tree blocking the view from one side.

content.text: Shortcut is a treasure hunt quest in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt.

On Undvik, head to the hidden treasure marker north of the lake here (west of the Dorve Ruins signpost), to find several bandits around a boat. Once they're dead, loot the bag on the small boat for the torn piece of paper and read it to start the quest.
Head out to the marker area (where you can see part of a ship sticking out of the water) and dive down to loot the chest here, which contains Bloed Aedd.

elements.text: Read the notes you found.
Search for treasure on the bottom of the lake using your Witcher Senses.

content.text: Sunken Chest is a treasure hunt quest in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt.

Head to the lone island south of Fyke Isle (north-northwest of Frischlow) where half a ruin stands. Once you near the campfire between the standing structure, about 5 drowners will appear. Deal with them, then loot one of the bodies nearby for the blood-smeared notes and read it to start the quest.

There are a number of chests here with a total of 12 random diagrams as well as a chest with the enhanced wolven armor diagram. However, the chest you want for this quest is in a submerged area with another chest (not the one with a hole in the ground). It's just east of the standing structure and where more drowners are circling in the water. One of these chests contains the Deithwen sword and will complete the quest.

elements.text: Read the notes you found.
Find the sunken treasure chest using your Witcher Senses.
Despite being in Velen, in the quest log this quest is labeled as being in Novigrad.

content.text: Sunken Treasure is a treasure hunt quest in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt.

To start this quest, head northwest of Hangman's Alley to the hidden treasure location. A body will be here with a water-damaged letter on him. Read it to start the quest, which will point you to a location out in the waters north of you.
Head out into the water and near the location are a couple drowners. Once dealt with, loot the chest here to complete the quest.

elements.text: Read the letter you found.
Find the sunken treasure using your Witcher Senses.
Despite being in Velen, in the quest log this quest is labeled as being in Novigrad.

content.text: Temerian Valuables is a treasure hunt quest in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt.

This quest can be picked up at the bridge southwest of White Orchard cemetery. A couple of drowners are here, so just take them out, then loot the body on the west side of the bridge. The key on the body unlocks the nearby submerged chest in the river. Read the notes found in the chest, which will direct you to go across the bridge and to the house near the windmill.
Use Aard to remove the obstacles on the way to the cellar. Once inside the hidden room, use your Witcher Senses to find the chest that the key will unlock.

elements.text: Read the document you found.
Find the lost Temerian treasure using your Witcher Senses.
There is a possible bug in this quest, when Geralt goes into the cellar, his hair will appear brown, unlike the usual white.

content.text: The Dead Have No Defense is a treasure hunt quest in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt.

Head to the hidden treasure marker far south of Duén Hen (about halfway to Byways) to find a camp of several deserters. Kill them off, then loot them to find the notes and key. After reading the letter, head back inland where, if you didn't find them earlier, a few more deserters are. After they're dead, loot the chest for Ultimatum and some random loot, completing the quest.

elements.text: Read the document you found.
Find the treasure in the catacombs using your Witcher Senses.
Despite being in Velen, in the quest log this quest is labeled as being in Novigrad.

content.text: The Things Men Do For Coin... is a treasure hunt quest in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt.
Head to the hidden treasure marker west of the Border Post and south-southeast of Ursten to find a dead body with a key a letter on it.

After reading the letter, follow the blood trail with your Witcher Senses towards the nekkers and deal with them before following the trail to some scaffolding and a half-hidden box here (the same scaffolding with a bee's nest on it). Loot it to complete the quest.

elements.text: Read the letter you found.
Find the looters' valuables using your Witcher Senses.
Despite being in Velen, in the quest log this quest is labeled as being in Novigrad.

content.text: Tough Luck is a treasure hunt quest in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt. It is a very quick quest to complete, as it only takes about one minute.

Southeast of the Devil's Pit, along one of the small roads, is a hidden treasure marker. This area is guarded over by a lone foglet who will soon appear once you approach the wagon here if he isn't already there. Kill it and then loot the two bodies here for a letter and a small key. Reading the letter will start the quest and use the key to unlock the chest on the wagon to complete it.

elements.text: Read the letter you found.
Find valuables near the destroyed wagon using your Witcher Senses.
Despite being in Velen, in the quest log this quest is labeled as being in Novigrad.

content.text: Unlucky's Treasure is a treasure hunt quest in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt.
Despite it being a treasure hunt, this is one of the toughest opponents one must face in the base game, guarded over by a high leveled archgriffin.
Go to Snidhall Isle north of the Ancient Crypt and make your way up the hills to the hidden treasure marker which happens to be right in the middle of an archgriffin's nest.
This archgriffin is no joke: it's strongly recommended you be around the same level or higher as, in the base game, it can be very hard to kill it before it kills you.

Once the archgriffin is dead, loot the body in the nest for the notes and a key, then head north towards the other summit to find a few more bodies around the treasure chest. Loot it to complete the quest.

elements.text: Read the document you found on the body.
Search the area using your Witcher Senses to find the treasure.
It is possible to kill the Archgriffin at any level with a well times Crossbow shot, which will cause it to fall into the ocean and result in an instant death.

content.text: X Marks the Spot is a treasure hunt quest in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt.

This quest starts at an unmarked, abandoned hut southeast of Blandare. The best way to find it is to head east from the hidden treasure marker in this area (north of the small lake) and go slightly south to see the hut. A white bear will be between it and the lake so be careful if you don't want to fight it.

Enter the hut and examine the skeleton here and loot the key and map to start the quest. Shortly after a wraith will spawn but depending if you left the building quickly, you may not have to fight it.

The chest location is just southeast of Fayrlund, where the hidden treasure marker is, and the chest is right at the base of the waterfall. A Wolf School symbol is carved to the rockside near it, making it highly visible when using the Witcher Senses. Note that you have to interact with this chest twice: once to unlock and a second time to actually loot it.

elements.text: Unfold the map.
Follow the map to find the treasure.

For an unknown reason, the treasure's location is denoted in the game world by a Wolf School symbol. This could be a hint for a piece of Wolf School gear found during Scavenger Hunt: Wolf School Gear Upgrade Diagrams - Part 6, however, this piece of equipment is located some distance west from the treasure chest in Kaer Nyssen. Furthermore, the symbol is uninteractable and disappears after the chest has been looted.
